DOCNAME: CASE OF KEPENEKLİOĞLU AND CANPOLAT v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violations of Art. 6-1;Not necessary to examine Arts. 6-2 and 6-3
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , are NORP nationals , who were born in DATE and DATE respectively . When they lodged their application with the ORG they were imprisoned in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicants were taken into custody in GPE by police officers from the GPE Anti - Terrorist Branch . On DATE they were detained on remand .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG at ORG filed a bill of indictment accusing the applicants of , inter alia , organised murder and armed burglary , as well as being members of an illegal terrorist organization .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG commenced the trial against the applicants and CARDINAL other accused and prolonged the applicants ' detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted the applicants under LAW and sentenced them to death .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG convicted them of the same crimes .
CARDINAL . On DATE , upon the applicants ' appeal , ORG upheld the judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . A full description of the domestic law may be found in the judgments of PERSON v. GPE ( no . ORG , § § DATE , DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) .
